channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: HMO resident with dog, 16th November
item.description:
A New resident has moved into the HMO with a dog and letting the dog foul between shorne close all the way to oakmore gardens alleyway and the dog is sometimes out alone with no owner
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Richborough Close, St Mary Cray, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street and footpath covered in leaves, which are very slipoy. The steep footpath is dangerously slippy due to leaves, 16th November
item.description:
The street is never cleaned. I regularly pick up litter but no roars sweeping is done. The drain at the top of the footpath is blocked with leaves and the steep footpath down to College Road is dangerously slippy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rock Hill, Dulwich, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins outside Westminster station on Bridge street, 16th November
item.description:
4 public bins all overflowing with rubbish in the ground all around each bin, plus rubbish on the walls all along the covered walkway- it was in such a mess and was like that all afternoon. It’s a health hazard and a safety risk

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canon Row, Millbank, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fence, bricks, and bed post being placed to block public right of way behind fire gate, 16th November
item.description:
Fence, bricks, and bed post being placed to block public right of way in Meadow View- this is the third time the resident has done this and has required local authority involvement to remove it each time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Meadow View, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Station staff illegally parking and driving on pavement, blocking bike racks as well. On entrance to station., 16th November
item.description:
Station staff illegally parking and driving on pavement, blocking bike racks as well. On entrance to station. This is a constant issue and I witnessed someone almost get run over earlier.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harbour Avenue, London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham

item.title: Leave Bags, 16th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Durning Road, West Norwood, London Borough of Lambeth

item.title: Outside 98/100, 16th November
item.description:
There was an accumulation of leaves on our street. They were wet and slippery so a potential hazard. They were also blocking the gullies which caused flooding in previous years. I cleared the sidewalks and gullies and there are now three bags of leaves outside number 100. Please can you collect them. Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charteris Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish continually dumped in this position, 16th November
item.description:
Bags constantly put in front of Dixon butler mews in the corner between number 10 and the gates of Dixon butler mews. Must be the residents of number 10 woodfield road as not sure else it would come from
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Woodfield Road, Maida Hill, City of Westminster

item.title: Bed base flytip, 16th November
item.description:
At the junction of bourdon road and worbeck road there is a wooden bed base flytipped
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Worbeck Road, Anerley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped cabinets and a bag of clothing, 16th November
item.description:
Dumped household renovation waste was cleared by the council on Saturday morning, but by Sunday morning, someone has dumped broken cabinets and a bag of clothes, in the same spot. This is so frustrating and annoying. Can Bromley Council install a cctv above the shop front window. This may result in irresponsible fly tippers being named and prosecuted. This spot has become a favourite place for local fly tippers, who have no pride in where they and we live. They are happy for other people to be stepping around rubbish, which should've been disposed of at the local refuse dump
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 210, Venner Road, Penge, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large white van has been parked right next to the junction for months now without moving causing real safety hazard as so close to junction, 16th November
item.description:
Three vans have been parked in a row at the end of Winchfield Road for around 3 months now. A large white van shown in the photo -‘d then behind that a smaller yellow van and then another white van. The large white van and yellow van have not been moved at all in that time. Nobody on the street seems to know who they belong to but people seem to think somebody is actually living in one of them. The main issue however is the fact that the large white van at the front is parked about 1 metre from the junction and I lots of other neighbours feel it’s really dangerous as forces you to drive out into the wrong lane when you’re approaching the junction so people have nearly crashed. Whilst I appreciate its technically not illegal to be parked there I do really think it is causing an unnecessary obstruction and so it won’t be long before it causes a crash. Also they seemingly don’t belong to anyone in the street but rather someone has just decided to park up and live there. Can someone please come and have a look and get them to move them?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winchfield Road, Perry Vale, Sydenham, London Borough of Lewisham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves need to be collected, 16th November
item.description:
The pavement and roads are dangerously full of leaves and I am 81 years old and worried that I am going to fall over
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oak Tree Gardens, Sundridge, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on wall at 1 Thornton Street SW9 6AG also in close proximity graffiti tags sprayed on white door opposite at 1 Drenchworth House SW9., 16th November
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a cream wall at 1 Thornton Street, Brixton london SW9. The graffiti faces a white door in very close proximity also sprayed with graffiti by the same culprit. The door is by the beginning of 1 Drenchworth House although not connected. Hopefully the images can specify for you the exact location. Please can the graffiti be removed. The graffiti has been there for a little over a month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 300-302, Brixton Road, Brixton, London Borough of Lambeth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned, crashed, untaxed car, 16th November
item.description:
Happened few days ago. Looks to me that (goodness knows how) the car hit the 'stinkpipe' and then somehow carried on across the junction to rest on The Avenue. Being rear wheel drive, that sort of possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Beckenham, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet
